intro: Malouetia obtusiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved malouetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Malouetia obtusiloba is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest flowering display.
